title: French tourist boats could have 'catastrophic effects' on seals and protected birds off Jersey's coast, experts warn
text:
Visitors to Les Ecrehous, a rocky reef six miles off the coast of Jersey, are often lucky enough to glimpse a grey seal bouncing between the waves, or a pod of bottlenose dolphins skimming past their boat.

But conservationists have warned the “unique” reef, along with its wildlife, could suffer "catastrophic effects" from too many visiting boats, after construction began at the nearest French harbour, Carteret, to double its moorings.

Up to 700 boats could now descend on the protected reef causing disruption to the area, and calls have been made for police or wardens to be deployed, to warn people over their “unacceptable behaviour”.

The reef, located just eight miles from Normandy, is protected...
